projects.title: SEER - Towards sustainable and energy efficient real estate education
projects.description:
Buildings and construction projects consume 40% of all energy, upon which it is no wonder that more attention will be paid to them. As maintenance and upkeep of buildings do matter, this inevitably means that qualification demands for real estate professionals will increase. This, in turn, force vocational institutions to get ready for answering to the following questions:

What will the future of the sector look like and what kind of new competence and training needs are emerging, e.g., due to the introduction of renewable energy and energy efficiency technologies, digitalization and smart operating systems? How should national and European further vocational education and training and qualifications be developed to cope with these challenges?

projects.title: Fighting Transborder Corruption
projects.description:
The EU-Russia Civil Society Forum (CSF)1
 Expert Group “Fighting Transborder Corruption” was founded by me in 2014 to address the issue of Transborder Corruption. 

Transborder Corruption is the problem of large international projects (e.g. infrastructure
or resource extraction) carried out in Russia or the EU with funds from EU or other international
funds, by EU or international corporations, which are accompanied by the violation of environmental and socio-economic rights and are often characterized by manifestations of corruption and lack of transparency.

The Expert Group sets as its main goal to address and fight this problem from the viewpoint of the
Human Dimension and from positions of civil society

profile_positions.description:
History. Russia. Dictators

Lectures and presentations on the history, politics, and culture of Russia, Ukraine, and Eastern Europe in the broadest sense.

Topics include:
- History of Kievan Rus'
- Russia under Mongol rule
- Medieval Russia
- Politics and economy in the USSR
- Russia under Putin
- Medieval Baltic history

- Dictators throughout history
